tuv.seg: A solicitor is a type of lawyer
Cineál dlíodóra is ea aturnae
To become a solicitor, you must complete an apprenticeship of at least 2 years and you must pass exams set by the Law Society at Blackhall Place in Dublin. (See 'how to apply' below)
Chun bheith i do dhlíodóir ní mór duit printíseacht dhá bhliain ar a laghad a dhéanamh agus ní mór duit éirí leat i scrúdaithe an Ollchumainn Dlí i bPlás Blackhall i mBaile Átha Cliath
Solicitors have a very wide range of different functions:
Tá réimse an leathan feidhmeanna an ag aturnaetha:
• A solicitor may give legal advice about non-contentious matters, such as buying a house or flat or drafting a will
• Is féidir le aturnae comhairle dhlíthiúil faoi chúrsaí neamhchointinneach a a thabhairt, leithéidí teach nó árasán a cheannach nó uacht a dhréachtú
• A solicitor may act as your agent or representative in commercial transactions
• Is féidir le aturnae feidhmiú mar do ghníomhaire nó ionadaí in idirbheartanna gnó

• Your solicitor may also give you legal advice and represent you in relation to a dispute or disagreement that you have with another party, for example, a family dispute or a dispute with your employer or your neighbour • A solicitor may give you legal advice about taking or defending a case

• Is féidir le do aturnae chomh maith comhairle dhlíthiúil a thabhairt duit agus feidhmiú ar do shon i gcás díospóide nó easaontais le páirtí eile, díospóid theaghlaigh do díospóid le do fhostóir nó comharsa
• If you are involved in a court case, your solicitor will manage the case and represent you when dealing with the other party
• Má tá páirteach i gcás cúirte, déanfaidh do aturnae an cás a bhainistiú agus tú a ionadú nuair atáthar ag déileáil leis an bpáirtí eile
For example, your solicitor will send letters to the other side on your behalf
Mar shampla, cuirfidh do aturnae litreacha chuig an páirtí eile ar do shon
Your solicitor will file all of the necessary court documents and contact the witnesses for the case
Déanfaidh do aturnae na doiciméid riachtanacha a chomhdú agus dul i dteagmháil leis na finnéithe don chás
• If it is necessary to involve a barrister in the case, your solicitor will "brief" the barrister by sending him/her all of the necessary documents and information
• Más gá abhcóide a tharraingt isteach sa chás, déanfaidh h do aturnae an abhcóide a mhiontheagasc trí na doicimed riachtanacha agus eolas a chur chuige/chuici
• Your solicitor may also actually represent you in court, although in the High Court and the Supreme Court, a barrister will usually be engaged
• Is féidir chomh maith le do aturnae feidhmiú ar do shon sa chúirt, ach san Ard Chúirt agus sa Chúirt Uachtarach déanfar abhcóide a úsáid
Unlike barristers, solicitors are allowed to join together to form partnerships or companies and they are allowed to advertise their services
Murab ionann agus abhcóidí is féidir le aturnaetha teacht le chéile chun comhpháirtíochtaí nó comhlachtaí a chur ar siúl agus is féidir leo a gcuid seirbhísí a fhógairt
Solicitors do not have to wear any special clothes when in court
Níl ar aturnaetha aon éadach speisialta a chaitheamh sa chúirt
If there is a barrister involved in the case, the solicitor will usually sit facing the barrister in the bench under the judge
Má tá abhcóide páirteach sa chás, is iondúil go mbeidh an aturnae ina shuí os comhair an abhcóide sa bhinse faoin mbreitheamh
If the barrister needs a matter to be clarified, he or she can then lean over to ask the solicitor
Má theastaíonn ón abhcóide go ndéanfaí ábhar a shoiléiriú is féidir leis/léi claonadh chun tosaigh le ceist a chur ar an aturnae
The Law Society sets down rules and regulations about how solicitors may conduct their business
Leagann an Cumann Dlí síos rialacha agus rialacháin faoin slí ina stiúraíonn aturnaetha a gcuid gnó
There is a Disciplinary Tribunal, which can investigate any allegations of misconduct made against a solicitor
Tá Binse Smachta ann, arb fhéidir leis aon líomhaintí mí-iompair a dhéantar i gcoinne aturnae a fhiosrú
Read more about making a complaint about a solicitor in Ireland here
Léigh tuilleadh faoi ghearán a dhéanamh i gcoinne aturnae in Éirinn anseo
Complaints about solicitors provided by the Legal Aid Board should be made as per the Legal Aid Board's complaints procedure
Ba chóir gearáin maidir le aturnaetha ar fáil ag an mBord um Chúnamh Dlíthiúil a dhéanamh chuig an mBord um Chúnamh Dlíthiúil
In December 2015, the Oireachtas passed the Legal Services Regulation Act 2015 which provides for, among other things, an independent complaints regime
I Nollaig 2015, rith an tOireachtas an tAcht um Rialáil Seirbhísí Dlí 2015 a fhorálann, i measc rudaí eile, do réimeas gearán neamhspleách
Solicitors' rates and fees vary greatly
Tá difríochtaí móra sna rátaí agus táillí a iarrann aturnaetha
Your solicitor is under an obligation to explain to you how much his or her fees will be before you engage him or her to act on your behalf
Tá sé d'oibleagáid ar do aturnae a mhíniú duit cén táille a bheidh ort a íoc sula ligeann tú dó/di feidhmiú ar do shon
Many solicitors take on cases on a "no foal, no fee" basis
Glacann cuid mhaith aturnaetha le cásanna ar an mbunús nach gcaitear iad a íoc muna n-éiríonn leis an gcás
This means that you will not be charged a fee by your solicitor if you do not win the case
Ciallaíonn seo nach mbeidh ort táille a íoc le do aturnae muna n-éiríonn leat sa chás
This is most common in personal injuries cases, i.e., where you have been injured in an accident
Is nós an-choitianta seo i gcásanna diobhála pearsanta, is é sin le rá nuair a gortaíodh tú i dtimpiste
You can read more about solicitor's fees in the Law Society's leaflet: Information in relation to legal charges (pdf)
Is féidir leat níos mó a léamh faoi tháillí aturnae sa bhileog an Dlí-Chumainn: Eolas maidir le muirir dhlíthiúla (pdf)
Read more about how to become a solicitor in Ireland here
Léigh níos mó faoi conas a bheith ina aturnae in Éirinn anseo
If you are a qualified lawyer from another jurisdiction (that is, outside Ireland), find out how to convert your qualifications to practice as a solicitor in Ireland
Má tá tú dlíodóir cáilithe ó dhlínse eile ((is é sin, lasmuigh d'Éirinn), a fháil amach conas a thiontú do cháilíochtaí a cleachtadh mar aturnae in Éirinn
As the regulatory body for solicitors in Ireland, the Law Society maintains a list of registered solicitors throughout the country
Mar an comhlacht rialála d'aturnaetha in Éirinn, coinníonn an Dlí-Chumann liosta aturnaetha cláraithe ar fud na tíre
Search the directory of solicitor firms throughout Ireland here
Cuardaigh an eolaire gnólachtaí aturnae ar fud na hÉireann anseo
